text:
If you’re looking for me, I’m the one in pj’s at 5:30 pm, holding a glass of wine and my new book…no promises that you won’t still find me here into tomorrow too. 🍷📖

It may be Monday for most, but it’s the start of my ‘weekend’ after working the last 2 nights. I was so jealous but honestly also happy for all my friends that I saw enjoying their cozy weekends at home with family (and books. 🤣) Well, now it’s my turn for the next 3 days! I plan on doing a heck of a lot of nothing but binging Secrets of the Morgue, Emily in Paris and…you guessed it, reading books! 

This book was a gift from my son and his girlfriend and it came in the most AHMAZING @reesesbookclub box with so many goodies! It was so thoughtful of them and I honestly screamed as I unwrapped it! You never imagine that someday your baby will be buying you presents; it always feels like it should always be the other way around. Anyway, he did GOOD. 😍

What’s your favorite celebrity book club?
~ Mine is definitely Reese’s Book Club!

.
.
.

Switched out my bedside table #bookstack because this gorgeous bunch of pink and yellow tulips a friend sent were calling out for company. It is a grey winter icescape out my bedroom window but this corner of my room is now a fresh little burst of spring. (Guess which book is Marco’s.)

🎉 HAPPY BOOK FACE FRIDAY 🎉

Have you seen September's #litfor2022 challenge? The prompt this month is READ A BOOK WITH A ONE WORD TITLE, so I thought I would share today my previous #bookface for LUCKY by @marissastapley
Details about the challenge and Giveaway is in the pinned post at the top of my page 🤗

💭 Have you ever won the lottery? I have only won small amounts on scratch offs.

Synopsis:
A thrilling roller-coaster ride about a heist gone terribly wrong, with a plucky protagonist who will win readers' hearts.

What if you had the winning ticket that would change your life forever, but you couldn't cash it in?

Lucky Armstrong is a tough, talented grifter who has just pulled off a million-dollar heist with her boyfriend, Cary. She's ready to start a brand-new life, with a new identity--when things go sideways. Lucky finds herself alone for the first time, navigating the world without the help of either her father or her boyfriend, the two figures from whom she's learned the art of the scam.

When she discovers that a lottery ticket she bought on a whim is worth millions, her elation is tempered by one big problem: cashing in the winning ticket means she'll be arrested for her crimes. She'll go to prison, with no chance to redeem her fortune.

As Lucky tries to avoid capture and make a future for herself, she must confront her past by reconciling with her father; finding her mother, who abandoned her when she was just a baby; and coming to terms with the man she thought she loved--whose dark past is catching up with her, too.

#bookfacefriday #bookswithonewordtitles #bookfaces #bookfacefridays #readingchallenge #readingchallenge2022 #fictionfriday #fictionaddiction #fridayfiction #luckybook

🍀BOOK REVIEW 🍀

"This is a story about a girl named Lucky"... No, really, it actually is!

What would you do if you had the winning lottery ticket for $290M... But your face was plastered all over the TV in wanted ads!?

This book had a little bit of everything!  The dual timelines focus on Lucky's childhood / present day and it's exciting to see how her past led her to the person that she is today.

I'd hands down recommend this one! It was a fun and crazy ride 💰💰

This was a @reesesbookclub pick last month too! #reesesbookclub 

QOTD : What's the best thing you've ever won?

#lucky #luckybook #marissastapley

Eight days after Syracuse man Anthony Broadwater was exonerated in the 1981 rape of Alice Sebold -- for which he served 16 years in prison -- the best-selling author has apologized and called the Syracuse resident an “innocent man.” See link in bio for complete story.

….and the streak continues! 
Y’all, this one might be my favorite of the year so far! I know, I know, I say that a lot, but seriously, it was so good! 

This book goes back between two different time periods, which I love. Lucky’s childhood and the present. 
Lucky was raised by her dad, a con artist, but all Lucky wanted was a normal life. 
Her current situation is no less drama. Lucky has pulled off a million dollar heist with her partner and love of her life, but is anyone who they say they really are?!
This one tugged at my heart strings some, as Lucky was always wanting to know about her mother who had abandoned her at birth. 
This story was a great one if you want to read about characters with grit and forgiveness! 

This quote got me! 
“People deserve second chances. And third chances. All people do is make mistakes. If we never forgave, we’d all be alone.”

💭 do you like a book to rotate between time periods or just stick to one? 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#luckybook #lucky #bookstagram #bookstagrammer #bookbythepool #bookbythepoolday #secondchances #mayhopefuls #reading #readingtime

And they say… SHE’S SO LUCKY. SHE’S A STAR!!! 🍀🎟💸 yep can’t stop singing it. 

😎LUCKY by Marissa Stapley 😎

Lucky was born into a life of crime. Her dad is one of the best swindlers out there — that is until he wasn’t. And Lucky and her boyfriend just wrapped up a huge complex con — one that Lucky herself didn’t know the extent of. Now she’s on the run on her own and the irony of it all? This wanted criminal also has a winning lotto ticket — but if she tries to cash it, she faces some serious prison time.

I thought this was a perfect palette cleanser when I was between two heavier reads. At just over 200 pages, I breezed through it. And I get why it was picked as a @reesesbookclub pick — it has a bit of a winding tale and you join the likable namesake main character along for the ride. I just really wasn’t impressed with the writing. Everything felt kind of rushed but at the same time it’s not like I was super hooked and wanted more. It was just an easy, solid read I thought was completely fine and what I needed! Really enjoyed how everything ends up (no spoilers 🤭)

#BookInEmojis: 👶🏼⛪️📿🎰🍾🕵🏼‍♀️💰🚍🐕🎟📺🥸🗺🤱🏼🔍🚔👮🏼‍♀️

Read if: Get A Clue was your favorite Disney Channel movie growing up and you love a criminal with a heart of gold story.

What’s been a perfect palate cleanser book for you?

#luckybook #reesewitherspoonbookclub #marissastapley #bookreview #bookstagrammers #readstagram #bookishlove #betterwithbooks #coolgirlsread #readingismagic #bookwormlife #whatshouldiread #booksbooksbooks #fortheloveofbooks #alwaysreading #bookstagramfeature #idratherbereading #readersofinstagram #bookrecommendations #bookaholic #bookstagramcommunity

In their rush to convict Anthony Broadwater for raping a college student in 1981, Syracuse police, prosecutors and judges cut corners. Every step of the way, people in power were convinced they were doing the right thing.
 
You know part of the story. Broadwater was wrongly convicted of raping Alice Sebold, a Syracuse University student who went on to become a best-selling author. Broadwater was exonerated in November, after 16 years in prison and 23 years on the sex offender registry. 
 
But what exactly went wrong and who is to blame? Full story coming on syracuse.com on January 25.

❤️ February Picks ❤️ 

🤍 It Ends With Us By Colleen Hoover. I am so incredibly late to the CoHo party but I excited to read this one. I have seen so many great reviews and can’t wait to see for myself what I’ve been missing all along! 

❤️ One Night On The Island By Josie Silver | I am a HUGE fan of Josie Silver. In fact, her book One Day in December is what got me back to reading. As soon as her last two books came available for pre-order I ordered them. Clearly, I have zero chill. As of now, it scheduled to arrive 2/15 (happy late Valentine’s Day to me!). I do have an alternate just in case it doesn’t. 😉 

🤍 Lucky by Marissa Stapley | I’ve seen this recently feature on Reese Witherspoons book club. I’ve past in my adventure to the book store but decided to pick up a copy. It not a very long book and I am always here for a quick read! 

What’s on your TBR list for February? Are you reading any of these?

SELLING FAST & FURIOUS 🔥🎖

#luckybook #booksforgpsc #gpscbooks 

https://eluckybookstore.com/products/nta-ugc-net-shikssnn-ane-snshodhn-abhiyaogyataa-komsen-paper-2-by-akshar

I read this book based on a review I read but I feel that it really overhyped it. "Lucky" is a decent enough story but not one that mesmerized me or held my undivided attention.  
 
Luciana, nicknamed Lucky, is a young woman who has learned to be a scam artist from her scammer father. They live on the rum, change their names and appearance frequently,  and come up against others who are just like them, and then they try to scam each other. The story takes us around the country as Lucky tries to find her biological mother, and also tries to find the way in which to cash in a multi-million dollar lottery ticket, which is harder than one would think, because she is wanted by the law.  Lucky has a good heart, and doesn't want to hurt people, but she can't help herself because it's all she knows.  
 
Is the ending happy? Some might think so - others not. 
PS: I could see this being made into a TV movie. #luckybook #lucky #lotterytickets #ontherun #fatheranddaughter #scammers #fiction #booksbooksbooks #bookstagram #readersofinstagram #librarybook #framinghampubliclibrary

LUCKY GANHOU MEU CORAÇÃO E EU VOU TE CONTAR O MOTIVO ✨ 

"(...) O mundo é assim. As coisas que em um momento são tão importantes, em outro já não são. As coisas se desfazem, mas, depois de um tempo, acabam se reconstruindo. Tudo passa." 💛

Lucky desde muito cedo precisou aprender a dominar algumas artimanhas para conseguir sobreviver e identificar os alvos perfeitos, enganá-los e, por fim, aplicar um calculado golpe de mestre. Após um roubo que lhe garantiu milhões de dólares, está prestes a embarcar em uma vida nova com o namorado, Cary, quando as coisas tomam um rumo completamente diferente do planejado. Agora, distante das emblemáticas figuras tanto do pai quanto do namorado, vai precisar percorrer territórios desconhecidos e recorrer a truques até então inéditos, tudo isso por sua própria conta e risco. É então que, de repente, sua sorte parece virar: um bilhete de loteria comprado por ela em um momento de impulso é o único ganhador de um prêmio multimilionário. Parece a grande solução para todos os seus problemas... se não esbarrasse em um obstáculo – para resgatar o dinheiro, Lucky precisa se identificar. Mas, foragida da polícia e com o rosto estampado em todos os lugares, como pegar a grana sem ir parar na cadeia?

Essa é a premissa de Lucky, uma história instigante com capítulos alternados entre presente e passado. Logo de cara já fiquei envolvida com a narrativa e a escrita da autora. Fora que a personagem Lucky é cativante! A autora faz com que sinta empatia pela personagem logo nas primeiras páginas e muito mais do que falar de uma golpista talentosa, Lucky irá falar sobre segundas chances, sobrevivência e perdão. Foi livro do Clube da Reese Witherspoon e imediatamente já fiquei curiosa com essa história! É um livro que não estava esperando gostar tanto, mas me ganhou completamente! 💛

➡️ JÁ QUERO SABER: TE CONVENCI A DAR UMA CHANCE PARA ESSA HISTÓRIA? FICARAM CURIOSOS? ✨

Lucky - Marissa Stapley @marissastapley

Lucky was raised by her con artist father, always running, hiding, changing identity; so inevitably this is also what she grows to become as an adult. The story alternates between her childhood, and present day as an adult navigating life amongst many secrets and lies.

This book is a fast-paced vibrant read that leaves indelible images in your mind as you follow Lucky on her journey to becoming the person she really wants to be; simply, someone who does good and is loved.

The story is scattered with twists and turns throughout; you feel her guilt and shame, and you find yourself really rooting for Lucky.

I really loved this book… I breezed through it in less that 24 hours. I truly hope @reesewitherspoon produces this as a TV show.

“Why could I not post my August Wrap-Up a few days into September?” I asked myself. I faced the dilemma of not wanting to disturb the aesthetic of my account that I developed over the past months but wanting this picture to look like it does. Sometimes Instagram planning doesn’t work out as initially planned and we end up seeing a wrap-up being posted on Labour Day 😅

Long story short, August was a great month for me, even though I “only” read 4 books. On some days I didn’t feel like reading and on some I had so many exciting things to do that I didn’t have time. The 4 books I read I really enjoyed and am happy to have made the time to read them.

Do any of you sometimes find themselves in a similar situation like me, either with your posts or when life becomes so exciting reading time gets cut short?
